intro: Eversmannia astragaloides, commonly known as the desert milkvetch, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, trifoliate leaves, and yellow to reddish-pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is adapted to drought conditions, with deep taproots that allow it to access groundwater. Its small, pod-like fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed and sandy soils. Eversmannia astragaloides plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitats.
